cleaned_text: Flu Vaccination Clinics The best way to protect yourself and others from the flu is to get vaccinated each year. It is safe to get the flu shot and the COVID-19 vaccine at the same time. Learn more about the [COVID-19 vaccine](/en/information/health-and-wellness/getting-the-covid-19-vaccine). Where to get your flu shot Starting in October 2023, Health PEI [Public Health Nursing](/en/information/health-pei/public-health-nursing) will offer Community Flu Vaccination Clinics at [locations across the province](#ClinicDatesLocations). Flu shots will also be available through your family physician or nurse practitioner and at pharmacies across the province. FluMist® (nasal spray) is available only at the Public Health Nursing Community Flu Vaccination Clinics. If you are 65 years of age or older, you should receive the influenza High-Dose Vaccine, available at Public Health Nursing Community Flu Vaccination Clinics and community pharmacies. Cost The flu vaccine is free to all individuals living in Prince Edward Island. You must bring your [PEI Health Card](/en/information/health-pei/pei-health-card) with you to the clinic. If you are not a Canadian resident, there is a $40 administration fee.
